result.taxonomicnotes:
The blue marginal band and brown lappets distinguishes it from other members of the genus.

This species previously appeared on the IUCN Red List in the genus Maylandia but is now considered valid in the genus Metriaclima (Konings 2016, Stauffer et al. 2016).
result.rationale: This species is endemic to Lake Malawi where it is known from three sites: Nkhotakota, Nkhomo Reef and Chidunga Rocks. It meets the area requirements under criterion B1 for Endangered and it is known from three locations. However, continuing declines in habitat quality or population size are possible but uncertain. The effects of aquarium trade and sedimentation on this species are unknown and it is therefore listed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This species is endemic to Lake Malawi where it has been recorded from Nkhotakota (Sani), Nkhomo Reef and from Chidunga Rocks.
result.habitat: It occurs in shallow intermediate habitats where most rocks are covered with a layer of sediment. It feeds from plankton and sometimes from the aufwuchs on rocks. Males are territorial. The maximum total length is about 11 cm.
result.threats: Sedimentation and collection for the aquarium trade are threats to this species.
result.conservationmeasures: No conservation actions are in place for this species. Site protection and management, and population monitoring are recommended.
result.usetrade: This species is rarely collected by the ornamental fish trade.
